intro: Uragoga angulosa, commonly known as the angular uragoga, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
